snippet: Clashes between rival rebel factions have harmed the Syrian opposition’s ability to halt gains by forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Deadly clashes between rival rebel factions in Syria accentuate divisions hampering opponents of Pres Bashar al-Assad as they try to halt his forces' gains on battlefield and persuade the West to supply the insurgency with weapons; fighting flares between members of mainstream rebel group and radical faction affiliated with Al Qaeda.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HANIA MOURTADA
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Raqqa, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Clashes between rival rebel factions have harmed the Syrian opposition’s ability to halt gains by forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Opposition in Syria Continues to Fracture
headline.print_headline: Opposition In Syria Continues To Fracture
